channel.title: Farhan Sadique
channel.description: Assistant Professor of KSU | Editorial Assistant @ Organization Development Network | Adult Learning and Leadership

item.title: Introduction
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded:
Hello there! I am a Ph.D. student, graduate assistant, money market investor, photographer, researcher, father of a fairy, and this is my website. I moved to State College, PA from Wichita, Kansas. I completed my Masters' from Pittsburg State University, KS. I am originally from Bangladesh, migrated to the USA with my wife in 2013. 

I had 5 years and 10 years goal in 2011, I was blessed enough to achieve my goals within 8 years. Now I am on my next mission, where I want to work internationally without a boundary. I feel suffocated living in the same place for more than 2 years, no wonder we sold our house and moved on. My dream job is to secure a faculty position and doesn't have to be in the USA. I am thinking about Singapore, Malaysia, or wherever life wants to take me. Or maybe I will found myself in State College after 20 years, I don't know, life is too unpredictable. We can wish things, but life will give me lemons and I will make lemonade until my daughter grows up enough to stop me from dreaming. 

I am a dedicated and responsible person, mostly praised for being an achiever. I act like an extrovert, but I am sure I wasn't the same person 10 years back. I had some great mentors and still blessed with outstanding mentors to guide me. I work hard to be the best, nothing less. I love my family, friends, and mostly care about everything in the moral circle.

item.title: Blog Posts
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded:
Book contribution as an editor: OD Review Essentials Volume 1: History & Evolution of Organization Development
The ODReview (ODR), originally titled ODPractitioner, published its first article titled Organizational Analysis and Organizational Improvement, in which Jay Lorsch and John Vail observed that clients view OD practitioners as “catalysts” who facilitate organizational diagnoses but position the responsibility for change with the client themselves. Since then, the ODR has advanced diverse perspectives, novel tools and frameworks, critiques, and editorials that push the discipline of OD forward.
To capture this rich history and evolution, my co-editors and I reviewed over 2500 articles published in the OD Review between 1968 and 2022. We are confident that each of these texts offers high-quality insights that may be enjoyed by practitioners who wish to inform and deepen their practice, as well as scholars looking for ways to connect new theories with foundational perspectives.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N9fNQv8s_Ss
  Hosted What the Flip Podcast with Dr. Aileen Zaballero https://sites.psu.edu/farhansadique/what-the-flip-podcast-with-drs-aileen-zaballero-dave-jamieson-bill-brendel-william-rothwell/ Organized a Reunion Program for the LPS department: Workstock Reunion 2022 https://sites.psu.edu/farhansadique/activities/workstock-reunion-2022/ Ph.D. Milestone : Comprehensive Exam 2022 https://sites.psu.edu/farhansadique/activities/completed-ph-d-milestone-comprehensive-exam/ NCDA Spotlight : April 2022 Student Spotlight https://www.ncda.org/aws/NCDA/asset_manager/get_file/679203?ver=0

item.title: Service Leadership
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded:
Serving WEGSA as a president for the academic year 2022-2023 is an honor. I am following the footsteps of my mentor and singing stars of our department; this is an opportunity to actively bring change to the department. A promising team to work with.  Learn more about WEGSA

My contribution has been recognized by Penn State and I have received Outstanding Organizational Officer award on 2021. I am immensely thankful for everyone for nominating and voting for me.

                   

Hosting Speechcraft as a part of Toastmasters in 2020

item.title: WorkStock Reunion 2022
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded: After years of isolation, Penn State Workforce Education and Development hosted a reunion for everyone from Learning and Performance System Department. It was an honor to lead such an eventful program with Dr. Angela Rogers and the team. Some moments from the event are below.

item.title: ODN International Conference 2022
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded:
I had a great experience presenting at the ODNetwork Conference 2022.
  • Rothwell, W., & Sadique, F. (2022, June 9). Facilitating social and organizational change. Conducted an onsite one-hour session at the Organization Development Network (ODNet) Conference in Orlando, FL.

item.title: Completed Ph.D. Milestone: Comprehensive Exam
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded: The experience is beyond my words. I still need to pass one more step to earn my Workforce Education and Development degree with a major in #organizationaldevelopment and #humanresourcedevelopment. I'd want to use this chance to express my #gratitude to everyone for their encouragement and help; without the #committee, Drs. Mark Threeton, William Rothwell, Wesley Donahue, and Rama Radhakrishna, it wouldn't be possible. I can't express how much Drs. Joon, Aileen, Leila, and Behnam, my #mentors and #rolemodels, have meant to me and my development. Particularly Dr. Joon, who spent hours improving my proposal, and Dr. Aileen, who spent hours preparing me for the exam, mean a lot to me, thank you. I will always be #grateful to my family, friends, and wife for their patience with me. Special thanks go out to Issa Al Balushi and my wife Tanjima Alam for holding me up through my tough moments and for constantly dealing with me! My goodness, it's a long journey and impossible without everyone around. I'm excited to share my educational milestone!

item.title: OD Network Conference Presentation
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded: It was an honor and mind blowing opportunity to present a timely topic with the legendary distinguished author and professor Dr. William J Rothwell. It's my third year working with Dr. Rothwell, and our presentation turned into a white paper and a book to be published in 2023. Team PENN STATE. We proudly represented Penn State at the International OD Network Conference 2022. And some silly moments. With Dr. William J Rothwell at OD Network International Conference 2022

item.title: About Farhan
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded: Farhan Sadique, Ph.D., SHRM-CP, OD&C Practitioner Dr. Farhan Sadique is an Assistant Professor of Higher Education and Leadership at Kansas State University, a certified Organization Development & Change (OD&C) practitioner, and an emerging leader in Human Resource Development. Recognized for his research-driven approach, he has trained over 300 professionals and authored Revolutionizing the Online Learning Journey: 1,500 Ways to Increase Engagement (Routledge, 2024). With expertise spanning OD, adult learning, and leadership, Farhan is dedicated to fostering inclusive, transformative learning environments and developing innovative tools to engage learners in virtual and classroom settings. Connect with Farhan as he shares insights on elevating organizational resilience and driving positive change in the global workplace. Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/farhansadique/

item.title: AHRD Conference Presentation
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded: Presented a poster at AHRD Conference 2020 and was fortunate to meet with some great people, including students, professors, and alumni.

item.content:encoded: What the Flip Podcast is a series of sessions with Provocative speakers and critical thinkers to stimulate a postmodern perspective on pressing challenges in the spirit of curiosity, innovation, and humanity. Photo from the Podcast Planning Session: Don't forget to click on this logo to listen to the latest podcast:

item.title: Activities
item.dc:creator: fvs5201
item.content:encoded:
ATD Kansas Regional Conference 2024, spreading Purple

 

Exciting new opportunity joined as an Assistant Professor in Educational Leadership in 2024

     

ATD OrgDev Conference 2024

I attended the ATD OrgDev Conference 2024 and presented the Bottom Up Change Process. Had an excellent opportunity to meet and enjoy dinner with Drs. William J Rothwell, Aileen Zaballero, Sandy Williams, and Ms. Sally Rothwell.

HR Trend Report Analysis 2024

This is an insightful and comprehensive analysis of the latest advancements in HR. Designed to help readers understand:
  • Holistic Research Findings: Discover the latest trends from a bird's-eye view.
  • Expert Opinions: Gain insights from leading experts and their perspectives on the trends shaping HR.
  • Educational Value: An ideal resource for students, educators, and anyone interested in reflecting on the HR trends of 2023.
  • Stay Informed: Keep up-to-date with the rapid developments in human resources.
Scan the code below or click https://rnareport.my.canva.site/report2023
  • [caption id="attachment_407" align="aligncenter" width="307"] Retrospective HR Trend 2023[/caption]

 

My Profile MyCPE

SHRM Certified Professional

AWARD Notification: OD Emerging Practitioner by OD Network 2023

   

AWARD Notification: Graduate Student Recognition Award 2023

[caption id="attachment_357" align="alignright" width="787"] College of education award recipients 2023[/caption]   College of Education faculty, staff and students celebrated at awards ceremony | Penn State University (psu.edu)      

______________________________________________________

Book contribution as an editor: OD Review Essentials Volume 1: History & Evolution of Organization Development

The ODReview (ODR), originally titled ODPractitioner, published its first article titled Organizational Analysis and Organizational Improvement, in which Jay Lorsch and John Vail observed that clients view OD practitioners as “catalysts” who facilitate organizational diagnoses but position the responsibility for change with the client themselves. Since then, the ODR has advanced diverse perspectives, novel tools and frameworks, critiques, and editorials that push the discipline of OD forward.
To capture this rich history and evolution, my co-editors and I reviewed over 2500 articles published in the OD Review between 1968 and 2022. We are confident that each of these texts offers high-quality insights that may be enjoyed by practitioners who wish to inform and deepen their practice, as well as scholars looking for ways to connect new theories with foundational perspectives.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N9fNQv8s_Ss
Buy the book from here: OD Review Essentials Volume 1: History & Evolution of Organization Development - OD Network
_______________________________________________________
 

Hosted What the Flip Podcast with Dr. Aileen Zaballero

Worked with an amazing team to host a Podcast with Dr. Aileen. It was full of fun moment. Don't forget to listen to some episodes, more to come.  https://sites.psu.edu/farhansadique/what-the-flip-podcast-with-drs-aileen-zaballero-dave-jamieson-bill-brendel-william-rothwell/
